intro: Micromeria parviflora f. monantha, commonly known as the single-flowered micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and related genera. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
